intro: Hibbertia basaltica, commonly known as the basalt rock-hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Hibbertia basaltica is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural settings.
